questions.question: Which statement correctly describes a NIC?
options: Component that establishes the physical connection, transmits and receives data
Device that connects a local network to the internet
Service that assigns IP addresses on the local network
Identifier that is 48 bits long for a device
questions.answer: Component that establishes the physical connection, transmits and receives data

questions.question: The ________ is required for a device to connect to a network and stores a MAC address assigned at manufacture.
The NIC converts between network data and computer-readable data.
Match each item to its role.

pairs.NIC: Component that connects a computer to a network and stores a MAC address assigned at manufacture
pairs.Network: Devices and computers joined together using cables or wireless technology
pairs.Router: Device that enables data packets to move between networks and can assign IP addresses via DHCP

questions.question: Which statement about a MAC address is correct?
options: It is allocated by the network whenever a device connects
It uniquely identifies a device and is assigned by the manufacturer
It consists of four numbers from 0 to 255 separated by full stops
It uses 128 bits written in hexadecimal groups separated by colons
questions.answer: It uniquely identifies a device and is assigned by the manufacturer

questions.question: A ________ is 48 bits long, which equals twelve hexadecimal digits.
Which describes the structure or format of a MAC address?
options: Six pairs written in hexadecimal, separated by colons or dashes
Eight hexadecimal groups separated by colons
Four decimal numbers separated by full stops
A device serial code only, which changes dynamically
questions.answer: Six pairs written in hexadecimal, separated by colons or dashes

questions.question: A MAC address is normally unchanged (universally administered address, UAA) but can be altered in some cases using a locally administered address (LAA).
Which comparison of IP versions is correct?
options: IPv4 uses 128 bits and IPv6 uses 32 bits
IPv4 uses four numbers separated by full stops; IPv6 uses hexadecimal groups separated by colons
IPv4 and IPv6 are both written as six hexadecimal pairs
IPv4 and IPv6 are both allocated by the manufacturer
questions.answer: IPv4 uses four numbers separated by full stops; IPv6 uses hexadecimal groups separated by colons

questions.question: A ________ can change each time the device connects to the network.
Each of the four numbers in an IPv4 address is from 0 to 255.
Which statement about an IP address is correct?
options: It is allocated by the network and used to locate a device on a network
It is assigned by the manufacturer and uniquely identifies the device hardware
It is 48 bits long and written as six pairs in hexadecimal
It is normally unchanged and known as a UAA
questions.answer: It is allocated by the network and used to locate a device on a network

questions.question: Which best states the routerâ€™s role?
options: Converts between network data and computer-readable data
Reads a destination address, forwards data to the correct destination, and connects a local network to the internet
Assigns a 48-bit address to each device at manufacture
Defines the 0 to 255 range used in IPv4
questions.answer: Reads a destination address, forwards data to the correct destination, and connects a local network to the internet

questions.question: On a local network, the router can assign IP addresses to devices.
Match forwarding context to the addressing method used.
Which statement about packet switching is correct?
options: Routers make per-packet, per-hop decisions; different packets can take different paths when a more efficient path is indicated
Routers always keep all packets on a single path
Packet switching requires IPv6 and cannot operate with IPv4
Packet switching assigns device serial codes during forwarding
questions.answer: Routers make per-packet, per-hop decisions; different packets can take different paths when a more efficient path is indicated
